sub_title: Freelance Product / UX Designer of simple solutions to complex problems. Have experience in many industries; automotive, games, travel, and e-commerce, and open to experience more industries.
summary:
I'm passionate about creating digital products and services that are meaningful and add joy to peoples' lives; one experience at a time. 

With more than 15 years experience in user-centered design both in-house and for a design-agency I've worked in a wide range of industries e.g.; Retail, Automotive, Entertainment, Consumer Electronics, Navigation, Travel. I've had the privilege of working with companies such as; IKEA, Albert Heijn, Bol.com and TomTom to name a few.     

My specialties are consumer and enterprise software, (eco)system thinking and cross-channel and platform design solutions. I like untangling complex processes, shaping them into Business- and User requirements, and transforming them into solid designs.

I love to work in multidisciplinary development teams across the whole journey; from design research, concepting, prototyping, design, user testing,  implementation, and bringing to market products and/or services.

projects.title: Wizard of Funk - Playlogic International/SCEE (PS3 / Playstation Eye)
projects.description:
Started as a game for the Playstation 2 with EyeToy, then Playstation 3 with Playstation Eye.

In this game kids would have adventure through a music themed world, and battle creatures by casting spells with handgestures; the more accurate the spell was cast, the more powerful its effects.  

Unfortunately the project was cancelled after 8 months.

projects.title: Worked on Concept and prototype for 2012 Renault Nav system
projects.description:
Designed and presented the design for the new 2012 Renault multimedia system. I left TomTom shortly after, but the system has hit the market as R-link. The final design has major changes compared to my proposals as expected, but there are some things left :)

http://www.renault.co.uk/ownerservices/multimedia/rlink.aspx

projects.title: TomTom Carminat for Renault
projects.description:
Created design, and guided development from A to Z of the TomTom Carminat Navigation system that is shipped for Renault Scenic, Clio, and Megane. Converted TomTom’s touch-screen interface to work with Renault proprietary controller to control both Navigation and media controls of the car.

Funny enough the official link above shows a photoshopped and incorrect screenshot; for better reference, please check the videos here: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL657CBE4646C3AF06

projects.title: Xyanide (Xbox)
projects.description: Twin stick shoot-them-up we did for the original Xbox. It was the studio's first title and when it was (finally) released in small numbers in the US; it received good acclaim in the niche of shoot-them-ups, but was not picked up by main stream gamers.

projects.title: Research project on capacitive screen
projects.description:
Did research on the possibilities of using the advanced capabilities a capacitive input device with regard application and usability within the context of safe-operation in a car-enviroment.

Based on this research I've written proposals that have (partially) been implemented in the TomTom GO Live 1000

profile_positions.description: UX designer for the checkout and loyalty teams. We're continually improving the functionality, customer-experience and conversion rates for the e-commerce websites of gamma.nl, gamma.be, and karwei.nl
profile_positions.title: Freelance UX Designer

profile_positions.description: After many years working in-house at various companies, in different industries, I decided to start my own company, and offer my UX services on a freelance and/or interim basis.
profile_positions.title: Freelance UX Designer

profile_positions.description: At Vive we're creating a great product that allows a safe, responsible, and accessible way to grow your money, and take control of your financial future!
profile_positions.title: User Experience Lead

profile_positions.description:
I was User Experience lead for tell Charlie, a SaaS start-up in the hospitality-tech space.
Responsible for the Service Design, User Experience, and Design Strategy.
profile_positions.title: UX Lead

profile_positions.description:
At bol.com I led the shopping team, the design team responsible for the well known list and product pages.

Between the seven teammmembers we solved a lot of design issues big and small; from tiny CRO improvements to bigger design topics like a product page redesign.

My role as a ream lead was about 70% leadership, stakeholder management and guidance/mentoring and 30% hands-on desigin-work.
profile_positions.title: UX team lead

profile_positions.description:
I worked as the lead of the multidisciplinary UX team of 6 people.

We worked on all aspects of the UI for what became the block-buster game: Horizon Zero Dawn (over 10 million copies sold). 

The Games interface, the menu's, icons etc. This was a huge task given the size and richness of the game. in the end i'm really proud of the work we've accomplished and how it worked out.

My role was about 50% stakeholder management, team-management, and 50% hands-on design work, mainly of Interaction Design, design-principles, and testing, tweaking, and adapting as the game solidified.
profile_positions.title: UX Lead

profile_positions.description:
frog design is a global innovation firm. 

frog works with the world’s leading companies, helping them to design, engineer, and bring to market meaningful products and services. With an interdisciplinary team of more than 1,600 designers, strategists, and software engineers, frog delivers connected experiences that span multiple technologies, platforms, and media.

frog works across a broad spectrum of industries, including consumer electronics, telecommunications, healthcare, energy, automotive, media, entertainment, education, finance, retail, and fashion. Clients include Disney, GE, HP, Intel, Microsoft, MTV, Qualcomm, Siemens, and many other Fortune 500 brands.

Founded in 1969, frog is headquartered in San Francisco, with locations in Amsterdam, Austin, Boston, Milan, Munich, New York, Seattle, and Shanghai. frog is a company of the Aricent Group, a global innovation and technology services firm.

At frog i worked on longer projects, mainly as a designer for the e-commerce site of Albert Heijn, where we grew the online groceries delivery channel for consumers and launched the pick-up service.

i also worked on the IKEA STORE app, an app that supported the IKEA customer before and during their visit to the store, allowing them to create a shopping list and where to find the products in their IKEA store.
profile_positions.title: Senior Interaction Designer

profile_positions.description:
Job description:
- Lead Game Designer of the Game Design team
- Create short-and longterm resource planning together with Project Manager.
- Monitor the design progress and productivity of the team
- Arrange briefings with the implementation teams
- Prioritize feature designs for implementation scheduling

Company went bankrupt in December 2010
profile_positions.title: Lead Game Designer

profile_positions.description:
Job description: 
Operating as a ‘design-liaison’ between TomTom’s design philosophy, and the vision of various car manufacturers and Tier 1 suppliers (ie Renault, Mazda, Sanyo, Sony); bridging  differences and securing synergies.

With the team of TomTom Eindhoven and Renault in Paris, we realized and launched the TomTom device that was factory fitted and integrated directly with Renault's HMI.

I was involved from the start of the project and created an interaction design that mapped all of the touch-based TomTom controls to Renaults proprietary control-stick. 

It was a big success with much higher take-rates than traditional navigation systems, and was sold in over 2 million cars like the Renault Scenic, Laguna,Megane, Clio
profile_positions.title: UX Design Lead Automotive

profile_positions.description:
Job description:
- Reviewing current products and giving recommendations for improvement
- Developing user interface concepts for new features/products
- User testing of products and/or concepts
profile_positions.title: Senior User Experience Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Job description: 
As a gamedesigner at Playlogic I was responsible for developing game concepts, story, rules, level design, user interaction, goals, progression-, risk- & reward structures, balance and feel of games. 

I worked as the designer on Xyanide for the original Xbox, which lauched in the US. 

Next to that I was directing, reviewing and designing external projects with SCEE, making sure the projects met their and our quality standards.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Gamedesigner
